member.name: T:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml
member.summary: Offers a convenient way to use to serialize objects using the XML format.

member.name: F:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.DefaultFormat
member.summary: Format used when null is passed to methods that take a format. Make sure not to modify this instance if any thread in the application might be in the middle of using ; ideally the options shoud be set once during startup and never changed after that.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.DeserializeFile``1(System.String,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Reconstructs an object of the specified type from the specified file.
member.typeparam: Type of object to read.
member.param: Options.
Path and filename of the file to read from.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.
member.returns: A new instance of the requested type.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.DeserializeFile(System.Type,System.String,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Reconstructs an object of the specified type from the specified file.
member.param: Type of object to read.
Options.
Path and filename of the file to read from.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.
member.returns: A new instance of the requested type.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.Deserialize``1(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Reconstructs an object of the specified type from the specified serialized form.
member.typeparam: Type of object to reconstruct.
member.param: Serialized form to reconstruct object from.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.
member.returns: A new instance of the requested type.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.Deserialize(System.Type,System.Xml.Linq.XElement,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Reconstructs an object of the specified type from the specified serialized form.
member.param: Type of object to reconstruct.
Serialized form to reconstruct object from.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.
member.returns: A new instance of the requested type.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.DeserializeIntoObject``1(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,``0,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Reconstructs an object of the specified type from the specified serialized form by applying the values to an existing instance of the type.
member.typeparam: Type of object to reconstruct.
member.param: Serialized form to reconstruct object from.
Object to assign values to in order to reconstruct the original object.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.DeserializeFileIntoObject(System.String,System.Object,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Reconstructs an object from the specified file by applying the values to an existing instance of the desired type. The type of object is inferred from the object passed in.
member.param: Path and filename of the file to read from.
Object to assign values to in order to reconstruct the original object. Also determines the type of object expected.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.SerializeToFile``1(``0,System.String,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Stores the specified object in a file with the given path and filename.
member.typeparam: Type of the object to store.
member.param: Object to store in a file.
Path and filename of the file to be created. If the file already exists, it is overwritten.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.SerializeToFile(System.Type,System.Object,System.String,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Stores the specified object in a file with the given path and filename.
member.param: Type of the object to store.
Object to store in a file.
Path and filename of the file to be created. If the file already exists, it is overwritten.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.Serialize``1(``0,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Converts the specified object into a serialized form.
member.typeparam: Type of object to convert.
member.param: Object to be serialized.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.
member.returns: The serialized form generated from the object.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXml.Serialize(System.Type,System.Object,RT.Serialization.ClassifyOptions,RT.Serialization.IClassifyFormat{System.Xml.Linq.XElement})
member.summary: Converts the specified object into a serialized form.
member.param: Type of object to convert.
Object to be serialized.
Options.
Implementation of a Classify format. See for an example.
member.returns: The serialized form generated from the object.

member.name: T:RT.Serialization.IClassifyXmlObjectProcessor
member.summary: Contains methods to process an object and/or the associated serialized form before or after (de)serializes it. To have effect, this interface must be implemented by the object being serialized.

member.name: T:RT.Serialization.IClassifyXmlTypeProcessor
member.summary: Contains methods to process an object and/or the associated serialized form before or after (de)serializes it. To have effect, this interface must be implemented by a class and passed into .

member.name: T:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXmlFormat
member.summary: Provides a format to serialize/deserialize objects as XML using and any serialization options which are format-specific. This class can only be instantiated through the factory method . See also .

member.name: P:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXmlFormat.Default
member.summary: Gets the XML Classify format with all options at their defaults.

member.name: M:RT.Serialization.ClassifyXmlFormat.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an XML Classify format with the specified XML-specific options.
member.param: Specifies the XML tag name to use for the root element of a serialized object.

member.name: T:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.CustomComparerExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods related to custom comparer.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.CustomComparerExtensions.OrderBy``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Comparison{``0})
member.summary: Sorts the elements of a sequence in ascending order by using a specified comparison delegate.

member.name: T:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods on the type.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.AllPairs``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of tuples containing all pairs of elements from the source collection. For example, the input sequence 1, 2 yields the pairs [1,1], [1,2], [2,1], and [2,2].

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.AllPairs``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of objects computed from all pairs of elements from the source collection.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.UniquePairs``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of tuples containing all unique pairs of distinct elements from the source collection. For example, the input sequence 1, 2, 3 yields the pairs [1,2], [1,3] and [2,3] only.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.ConsecutivePairs``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of tuples containing all consecutive pairs of the elements.
member.param: The input enumerable.

If true, an additional pair containing the last and first element is included. For example, if the source collection contains { 1, 2, 3, 4 } then the enumeration contains { (1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4) } if is false, and { (1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4), (4, 1) } if is true.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.SelectConsecutivePairs``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Boolean,System.Func{``0,``0,``1})
member.summary: Enumerates all consecutive pairs of the elements.
member.param: The input enumerable.

If true, an additional pair containing the last and first element is included. For example, if the source collection contains { 1, 2, 3, 4 } then the enumeration contains { (1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4) } if is false, and { (1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4), (4, 1) } if is true.
The selector function to run each consecutive pair through.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.Order``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Sorts the elements of a sequence in ascending order.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.Order``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0})
member.summary: Sorts the elements of a sequence in ascending order by using a specified comparer.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.Split``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Splits the specified IEnumerable at every element that satisfies a specified predicate and returns a collection containing each sequence of elements in between each pair of such elements. The elements satisfying the predicate are not included.
member.param: The collection to be split.
A predicate that determines which elements constitute the separators.
member.returns: A collection containing the individual pieces taken from the original collection.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.Concat``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},``0)
member.summary: Adds a single element to the end of an .
member.typeparam: Type of enumerable to return.
member.returns: IEnumerable containing all the input elements, followed by the specified additional element.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.Concat``1(``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Adds a single element to the start of an .
member.typeparam: Type of enumerable to return.
member.returns: IEnumerable containing the specified additional element, followed by all the input elements.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.OrderLazy``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: This does the same as , but it is much faster if you intend to extract only the first few items using .
member.param: The sequence to be sorted.
member.returns: The given with its elements sorted progressively.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.OrderLazy``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0})
member.summary: This does the same as , but it is much faster if you intend to extract only the first few items using .
member.param: The sequence to be sorted.
An instance of specifying the comparison to use on the items.
member.returns: The given IEnumerable<T> with its elements sorted progressively.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.Permutations``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns all permutations of the input .
member.param: The list of items to permute.
member.returns: A collection containing all permutations of the input .

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.Subsequences``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns all subsequences of the specified lengths of the input .
member.param: The sequence of items to generate subsequences of.
The minimum length of a subsequence to return. Must be between 0 and the length of the input collection.
The maximum length of a subsequence to return. Must be between 0 and the length of the input collection. If null is specified, the size of the input collection is used.
member.returns: A collection containing all matching subsequences of the input .

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.FirstOrNull``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns the first element of a sequence, or null if the sequence contains no elements.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: The to return the first element of.
member.returns: null if is empty; otherwise, the first element in .

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.FirstOrNull``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Returns the first element of a sequence that satisfies a given predicate, or null if the sequence contains no elements.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: The to return the first element of.
Only consider elements that satisfy this predicate.
member.returns: null if is empty; otherwise, the first element in .

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.FirstOrDefault``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},``0)
member.summary: Returns the first element of a sequence, or a default value if the sequence contains no elements.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: The to return the first element of.
The default value to return if the sequence contains no elements.
member.returns: if is empty; otherwise, the first element in .

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.FirstOrDefault``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean},``0)
member.summary: Returns the first element of a sequence, or a default value if the sequence contains no elements.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
member.param: The to return the first element of.
A function to test each element for a condition.
The default value to return if the sequence contains no elements.
member.returns: if is empty or if no element passes the test specified by ; otherwise, the first element in that passes the test specified by .

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.FirstOrDefault``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean},System.Func{``0,``1},``1)
member.summary: Returns the first element of a sequence, or a default value if the sequence contains no elements.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
The type of the resulting value.
member.param: The to return the first element of.
A function to test each element for a condition.
A function to transform the first element into the result value. Will only be called if the sequence contains an element that passes the test specified by .
The default value to return if the sequence contains no elements.
member.returns: if is empty or if no element passes the test specified by ; otherwise, the transformed first element in that passes the test specified by .

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.IndexOf``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Returns the index of the first element in this satisfying the specified . If no such elements are found, returns -1.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.IndexOf``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean},System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the index of the first element in this satisfying the specified , starting at the specified . If no such elements are found, returns -1.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.LastIndexOf``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Returns the index of the last element in this satisfying the specified . If no such elements are found, returns -1.
member.remarks: This method is optimised for the case in which the input sequence is a list or array. In all other cases, the collection is evaluated completely before this method returns.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.IndexOf``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``0})
member.summary: Returns the index of the first element in this that is equal to the specified as determined by the specified . If no such elements are found, returns -1.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.SkipLast``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates the items of this collection, skipping the last items. Note that the memory usage of this method is proportional to , but the source collection is only enumerated once, and in a lazy fashion. Also, enumerating the first item will take longer than enumerating subsequent items.
member.param: Source collection.
Number of items to skip from the end of the collection.
If true, the enumerator throws at the end of the enumeration if the source collection contained fewer than elements.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.IEnumerableExtensions.TakeLast``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a collection containing only the last items of the input collection. This method enumerates the entire collection to the end once before returning. Note also that the memory usage of this method is proportional to .

The type of the keys returned by .
The type of the keys returned by .
member.param: Source collection to create a dictionary from.
A function to extract the first-level key from each element.
A function to extract the second-level key from each element.
An equality comparer to compare the first-level keys.
An equality comparer to compare the second-level keys.

member.summary: Creates a two-level dictionary from an enumerable collection according to two specified key selector functions and optional key comparers.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of .
The type of the keys returned by .
The type of the keys returned by .
The type of the value returned by .
member.param: Source collection to create a dictionary from.
A function to extract the first-level key from each element.
A function to extract the second-level key from each element.
A transform function to produce a result element value from each element.
An equality comparer to compare the first-level keys.
An equality comparer to compare the second-level keys.

Key at which the list is located in the IDictionary.

member.param: IDictionary to operate on.

Type of the key of the inner Dictionary.
Type of the values in the inner Dictionary.
member.param: Dictionary to operate on.
Key at which the inner Dictionary is located in the outer Dictionary.
Key at which the value is located in the inner Dictionary.
Value to add to the inner Dictionary.
Optional equality comparer to pass into the inner dictionary if a new one is created.

member.param: Dictionary to operate on.
Key at which the inner Dictionary is located in the outer Dictionary.

If true, does not escape single quotes (', U+0027).

member.name: P:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions._filenameDisallowedCharacters
member.summary: Contains the set of characters disallowed in file names across all filesystems supported by our software.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.FilenameCharactersEscape(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Escapes all characters in this string which cannot form part of a valid filename on at least one supported filesystem. The escaping is fully reversible (via ), but does not treat characters at specific positions differently (e.g. the "." at the end of the name is not escaped, even though it will disappear on a Win32 system).

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.FilenameCharactersUnescape(System.String)
member.summary: Reverses the transformation done by . This routine will also work on filenames that cannot have been generated by the above escape procedure; any "invalid" escapes will be preserved as-is.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.Base64UrlEncode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes this byte array to base-64-url format, which is safe for use in URLs and does not contain the unnecessary padding when the number of bytes is not divisible by 3.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.Base64UrlDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes this string from base-64-url encoding, which is safe for use in URLs and does not contain the unnecessary padding when the number of bytes is not divisible by 3, into a byte array.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.CLiteralEscape(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes all characters in this string whose code is less than 32 or form invalid UTF-16 using C/C#-compatible backslash escapes.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.CLiteralUnescape(System.String)
member.summary: Reverses the escaping done by . Note that unescaping is not fully C/C#-compatible in the sense that not all strings that are valid string literals in C/C# can be correctly unescaped by this procedure.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.Trim(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the specified collection, but with leading and trailing empty strings and nulls removed.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.WordWrap(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Word-wraps the current string to a specified width. Supports UNIX-style newlines and indented paragraphs.

remarks.para: The supplied text will be split into "paragraphs" at the newline characters. Every paragraph will begin on a new line in the word-wrapped output, indented by the same number of spaces as in the input. All subsequent lines belonging to that paragraph will also be indented by the same amount.
All multiple contiguous spaces will be replaced with a single space (except for the indentation).

member.param: Text to be word-wrapped.
The maximum number of characters permitted on a single line, not counting the end-of-line terminator.
The number of spaces to add to each line except the first of each paragraph, thus creating a hanging indentation.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.UnifyLineEndings(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to detect Unix-style and Mac-style line endings and converts them to Windows (\r\n).

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.UrlStartsWith(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified URL starts with the specified URL path. For example, the URL "/directory/file" starts with "/directory" but not with "/dir".

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.SubstringSafe(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as but does not throw exceptions when the start index falls outside the boundaries of the string. Instead the result is truncated as appropriate.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.SubstringSafe(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as but does not throw exceptions when the start index or length (or both) fall outside the boundaries of the string. Instead the result is truncated as appropriate.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.EqualsNoCase(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.ContainsNoCase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether this string contains the other string under the ordinal case-insensitive comparison ().

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.StartsWith(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns true if and only if this string starts with the specified character.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.FromHex(System.String)
member.summary: Reconstructs a byte array from its hexadecimal representation (hexdump).

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.Unindent(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the overall indentation of the specified string while maintaining the relative indentation of each line.
member.param: String to remove indentation from.
member.returns: A string in which every line that isnt all whitespace has had spaces removed from the beginning equal to the least amount of spaces at the beginning of any line.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.Indent(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts spaces at the beginning of every line contained within the specified string.
member.param: String to add indentation to.
Number of spaces to add.
If true (default), all lines are indented; otherwise, all lines except the first.
member.returns: The indented string.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.RemoveCommonIndentation(System.String)
member.summary: Removes spaces from the beginning of every line in such a way that the smallest indentation is reduced to zero. Lines which contain only whitespace are not considered in the calculation and may therefore become empty.
member.param: The string to transform.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.Split(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits a string into chunks of equal size. The last chunk may be smaller than , but all chunks, if any, will contain at least 1 character.
member.param: String to split into chunks.
Size of each chunk. Must be greater than zero.
member.returns: A lazy-evaluated collection containing the chunks from the string.

Strings that delimit the substrings in this string.
member.returns: An array whose elements contain the substrings in this string that are delimited by one or more strings in separator. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.returns: An array whose elements contain the substrings in this string that are delimited by one or more strings in separator. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.IsNumeric(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the string contains only the characters 0-9.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StringExtensions.AddLine(System.String,System.String)

member.name: T:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.JsQuotes
member.summary: Selects how the escaped JS string should be put into quotes.

member.name: F:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.JsQuotes.Single
member.summary: Put single quotes around the output. Single quotes are allowed in JavaScript only, but not in JSON.

member.name: F:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.JsQuotes.Double
member.summary: Put double quotes around the output. Double quotes are allowed both in JavaScript and JSON.

member.name: F:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.JsQuotes.None
member.summary: Do not put any quotes around the output. The escaped output may be surrounded with either type of quotes.

Comparer to use for comparing the results of the selector function. If null, the default comparer is used; this comparer will use the IComparable interface if implemented.

member.summary: Constructor which re-uses the default hash function. Use this overload only if using the objects original hash function is appropriate for this equality comparison.
member.param: Provides the comparison function for this equality comparer.

member.name: M:RT.Util.CustomEqualityComparer`1.By``1(System.Func{`0,``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{``0})
member.summary: Creates and returns an equality comparer that compares the equality of objects by comparing the equality of the result of a selector function.
member.param: Function selecting the actual value to be compared.
Comparer to use for comparing the results of the selector function.

member.name: M:RT.Util.CustomEqualityComparer`1.By``1(System.Func{`0,``0},System.Func{``0,``0,System.Boolean},System.Func{``0,System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates and returns an equality comparer that compares the equality of objects by comparing the equality of the result of a selector function.
member.param: Function selecting the actual value to be compared.
Function used to compare values for equality. If null, will use IEquatable if implemented, or the object's Equals override.
Function used to compute hash codes. If null, will use IEquatable if implemented, or the object's GetHashCode override.

member.name: M:RT.Util.CustomEqualityComparer`1.By(System.Func{`0,System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates and returns an equality comparer that compares the equality of objects by comparing the equality of the result of a string selector function.
member.param: Function selecting the actual string value to be compared.
If false, an invariant culture string comparison is used. Otherwise, an ordinal no-case comparison (suitable for filenames etc).
